attributes.action: legislate routine testing for streptococcus meningitis in pregnant women
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: After the sad story of Grace Vincent the tiny baby who contracted group B streptococcus meningitis from her mother, a carrier, a lesson needs to be learnt. This little girls illness was preventable, had routine screening for pregnant women been in place. It is done as standard in the USA and other European countries, we need to follow their lead as a matter of urgency. Prevention is better than cure.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "legislate routine testing for streptococcus meningitis in pregnant women."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22360


Prime Minister's Office
